VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.
Financial Overview
The 2023 financial audit and 2024 annual budget were reviewed. No concerns
were noted.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment dated 6/21/24 was reviewed. The agency did
not have any prior corrective action plans. The Chief Administrator reported file
reviews are conducted on a regular basis and determined the agency was in full
compliance.
The Chief Administrator identified unplanned discharges of youth due to a power
outage at the building, one youth that injured staff, and child illness requiring the
respite to end early. There were no concerns about systemic factors contributing to
youth being discharged.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Two staff were interviewed on site. Staff reported being satisfied with their work and
supported by the agency. No concerns or suggestions for improvement were noted.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The facility continues to be located in the same building as previous years. The
facility was found to be clean and organized. Bedrooms had appropriate bedding,
play and visit areas were clean and had several activities available for children.
3

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
